Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Fort \Fort\, n. [F., from fort strong, L. fortis; perh. akin to Skr. darh to fix, make firm, and to E. firm Cf. {Forte}, {Force}, {Fortalice}, {Comfort}, {Effort}.] (Mil.) A strong or fortified place; usually, a small fortified place, occupied only by troops, surrounded with a ditch, rampart, and parapet, or with palisades, stockades, or other means of defense; a fortification. [1913 Webster]
Detached works, depending solely on their own strength, belong to the class of works termed forts. --Farrow. [1913 Webster]

fort n 1: a fortified military post where troops are stationed [syn: {garrison}] 2: a fortified defensive structure [syn: {fortress}] v 1: gather in, or as if in, a fort, as for protection or defense [syn: {fort up}] 2: enclose by or as if by a fortification [syn: {fortify}] 3: station (troops) in a fort
